intro: Lachenalia capensis, commonly known as the Cape bell-shaped lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Lachenalia capensis is a bulbous perennial that produces showy blooms in late spring to early summer. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
